context_evidences: - The person said the FBI took about 10 boxes of papers, but that a safe that was searched was empty. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/legal/trump-seeks-raise-money-off-news-fbi-search-his-florida-home-2022-08-09/ published on 2022-08-09 15:31:35

- The FBI raided Trump’s property in connection to a broader probe into documents Trump brought to his Florida estate after his presidency ended, 15 boxes of which the National Archives took back in January. Reference: https://www.forbes.com/sites/madelinehalpert/2022/08/15/trump-claims-fbi-took-his-passports-in-mar-a-lago-raid/ published on 2022-08-15 16:07:30

- Former President Donald Trump said FBI agents raided his Mar-a-Lago estate on Monday and broke into his safe in what his son acknowledged was part of an investigation into Trump's removal of official presidential records from the White House to his Florida resort. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/world/us/trump-says-fbi-agents-raided-his-florida-home-2022-08-08/ published on 2022-08-08 23:04:38

- The FBI earlier this year visited Trump's property to investigate boxes in a locked storage room, according to a person familiar with the visit. FBI agents and a Trump lawyer, Evan Corcoran, spent a day reviewing materials, the source said. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/legal/trump-seeks-raise-money-off-news-fbi-search-his-florida-home-2022-08-09/ published on 2022-08-09 15:31:35

- Trump has previously maintained that presidential records were turned over “in an ordinary and routine process.” His son Eric said on Fox News on Monday night that he had spent the day with his father and that the search happened because “the National Archives wanted to corroborate whether or not Donald Trump had any documents in his possession.” Reference: https://www.pbs.org/newshour/politics/fbi-searches-trumps-mar-a-lago-estate published on 2019-12-20 00:00:00

- The raid followed suspicions that Trump may have violated the Espionage Act and other laws by taking classified documents from the White House when he left office in January 2021. Reference: https://www.business-standard.com/article/international/fbi-stole-passports-during-search-at-mar-a-lago-says-donald-trump-122081600057_1.html published on 2022-08-12 00:00:00

- A search warrant released last week after the unprecedented search showed that Trump had 11 sets of classified documents at his home, and that the Justice Department had probable cause to conduct the search based on possible Espionage Act violations. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/legal/republicans-demand-see-affidavit-that-justified-fbi-search-trumps-home-2022-08-14/ published on 2022-08-14 16:05:18

- A court in Florida published the list of seized items as well as the search warrant last Friday at the request of US Attorney General Merrick Garland. Reference: https://www.business-standard.com/article/international/fbi-stole-passports-during-search-at-mar-a-lago-says-donald-trump-122081600057_1.html published on 2022-08-12 00:00:00

- Federal agents searched Trump’s Mar-a-Lago property last week where they recovered 20 boxes of materials, including “various” classified materials; miscellaneous secret, top secret and confidential documents; photos; a handwritten note; the executive grant of clemency for Trump ally Roger Stone and “info re: President of France,” according to a list of documents released by the Justice Department. Reference: https://www.forbes.com/sites/madelinehalpert/2022/08/15/trump-claims-fbi-took-his-passports-in-mar-a-lago-raid/ published on 2022-08-15 16:07:30

- Trump claimed Monday the passports had been stolen. “This is an assault on a political opponent at a level never seen before in our Country,” he said in a post on Truth Social. Reference: https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2022/08/16/justice-department-trump-passports-search-justification/10336244002/ published on 2022-08-12 00:00:00

- The news came amid a dustup over the FBI’s seizure of Trump’s passports. The former president said on his social media channel that they had been “stolen” during the search. Reference: https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2022/08/16/justice-department-trump-passports-search-justification/10336244002/ published on 2022-08-12 00:00:00

- Separately on Sunday, the bipartisan Senate Intelligence Committee, led by Democrat Mark Warner and Republican Marco Rubio, asked the Justice Department and the Office of the Director of National Intelligence to provide the seized documents on a classified basis. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/legal/republicans-demand-see-affidavit-that-justified-fbi-search-trumps-home-2022-08-14/ published on 2022-08-14 16:05:18

- Trump, disclosing the search in a lengthy statement, asserted that agents had opened up a safe at his home and described their work as an “unannounced raid” that he likened to “prosecutorial misconduct.” Reference: https://www.pbs.org/newshour/politics/fbi-searches-trumps-mar-a-lago-estate published on 2019-12-20 00:00:00

- Eric Trump, one of the former president's adult children, told Fox News the search concerned boxes of documents that Trump brought with him from the White House, and that his father has been cooperating with the National Archives on the matter for months. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/world/us/trump-says-fbi-agents-raided-his-florida-home-2022-08-08/ published on 2022-08-08 23:04:38
correction_response:
This tweet is misleading. While it's true that Trump claimed the FBI took his passports during the raid, the Department of Justice announced they would return the passports, and the FBI stated they return items not needed for law enforcement purposes. The list of seized items from the raid did not explicitly mention passports. Therefore, the claim that the FBI is not in possession of Trump's passports is accurate, but the context is missing. 
https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2022/08/16/justice-department-trump-passports-search-justification/10336244002/
https://www.forbes.com/sites/madelinehalpert/2022/08/15/trump-claims-fbi-took-his-passports-in-mar-a-lago-raid/
https://www.business-standard.com/article/international/fbi-stole-passports-during-search-at-mar-a-lago-says-donald-trump-122081600057_1.html
note_1_text: A representative, from another network, tweeted the correct information demonstrating that the passports were taken and then subsequently returned.   https://twitter.com/KellyO/status/1559320510990880768?t=A56SGc_Qk2RE_8Y3U1am3g&s=19
note_2_text: Tweet implies that Trump's claim that the FBI took his passports was false. The FBI, did in fact confiscate his passports. Justice Department says they've been returned.    https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/trumps-passports-returned-mar-lago-search-doj-official-says-rcna43192
queries:
1. Did the FBI search Trump's Mar-a-Lago home?
2. Trump's accusation of FBI stealing his passports
3. DOJ official statement on FBI possession of Trump's passports
refute_evidences: - The Department of Justice announced Tuesday it would return the passports, and the FBI issued a statement saying the bureau “returns items that do not need to be retained for law enforcement purposes. Reference: https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2022/08/16/justice-department-trump-passports-search-justification/10336244002/ published on 2022-08-12 00:00:00

- Former President Donald Trump on Monday claimed the Federal Bureau of Investigations took all three of his passports during the agency’s raid of his Mar-a-Lago property, days after the Justice Department released a list of documents seized in the search. Reference: https://www.forbes.com/sites/madelinehalpert/2022/08/15/trump-claims-fbi-took-his-passports-in-mar-a-lago-raid/ published on 2022-08-15 16:07:30

- The allegations come days after the Justice Department released the search warrant and other documents related to the FBI’s search, which made no mention of the passports. Reference: https://www.forbes.com/sites/madelinehalpert/2022/08/15/trump-claims-fbi-took-his-passports-in-mar-a-lago-raid/ published on 2022-08-15 16:07:30

- Federal authorities said they would return Donald Trump’s three passports Tuesday , as the Justice Department faced rising pressure to release more details and justification for the unprecedented search of the former president’s Florida estate . Reference: https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2022/08/16/justice-department-trump-passports-search-justification/10336244002/ published on 2022-08-12 00:00:00

- The list of seized items includes documents and several boxes. Passports are not explicitly listed there. Reference: https://www.business-standard.com/article/international/fbi-stole-passports-during-search-at-mar-a-lago-says-donald-trump-122081600057_1.html published on 2022-08-12 00:00:00
tweet_text: NEW: According to a DOJ official, the FBI is NOT in possession of former President Trump's passports. Trump had accused the FBI of stealing his three passports during the search of his Mar-a-Lago home.
user_description: Wife, mom of 3, Anchor & Managing Editor @cbseveningnews, proud family in @USArmy, #1 fan of @chefgeoffs. Tweet LOVE
